bibliographic_metadata.Title: Prospectivity Modeling of Devonian Intrusion-Related W–Mo–Sb–Au Deposits in the Pokiok Plutonic Suite, West-Central New Brunswick, Canada, Using a Monte Carlo-Based Framework
Author: Amirabbas Karbalaeiramezanali
Mohammad Parsa
David R. Lentz
Kathleen G. Thorne

abstract: This study aimed to identify potential exploration targets for intrusion-related W–Mo–Sb–Au deposits in the Pokiok Plutonic Suite using knowledge-driven mineral prospectivity mapping techniques. A multifaceted approach combining mineral systems, parsimonious weighting methods, Monte Carlo simulation, and risk-return analysis was adopted to mitigate uncertainties. The methodology allows for confident selection of exploration targets, predicting 73% of known occurrences while reducing the search space by 15%.
methodology: supervised > tree-based > random forest; supervised > tree-based > gradient boosting (GBDT); supervised > tree-based > decision tree (CART)
key_points: Utilized Monte Carlo simulation to address uncertainties in prospectivity mapping.
Combined multiple decision-making methods for effective mineral exploration.
Identified low-risk, high-return target areas that predict 73% of known deposits.
